summary: Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report documenting Jeffrey Epstein's attempted suicide by hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on July 23, 2019. The report notes his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff, and Epstein was found unresponsive but breathing with an orange homemade rope around his neck.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate who attempted to hang himself in his cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who alerted staff to Epstein's suicide attempt.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein suicide attempt in MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself in his cell using an orange homemade rope. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff. Epstein was found unresponsive but breathing.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was present and alerted staff to the incident.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck, unresponsive but breathing.
The incident was classified as 'Self-Mutilation' under Prohibited Act Code 228.
The report indicates the incident was referred to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) for further hearing.
